drupalNodeEvent.title: Spring 2022: Current State of US-China Relations

field_speakers.processed:
• Craig Allen, President, US-China Business Council
  • Jan Berris, Vice President, National Committee on U.S. China Relations
  • Alyssa Tracey, Director of International Trade, State of Michigan
  • Lynn Paine, Associate Dean for International Studies, College of Education, MSU
  • Manual Chavez, Professor, Journalism, College of Communication Arts and Sciences, MSU

field_organizers.processed:
Michigan State University Office of China Programs

Michigan State University International Business Center/MSU-CIBER at Broad College

field_description.processed: The Michigan State University Office of China Programs, the International Business Center/MSU-CIBER at Broad College, and other cosponsors are pleased to present this expert panel on US-China relations with a unique Michigan focus. The panel will respond to questions from the MSU community about Russia-China-US relations, global trade, and much more. This panel was designed in partnership with the US-China Business Council, the National Committee on U.S.-China Relations, and the Michigan Economic Development Corporation.
